CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 14, 1955, pg. 15 reads: " Clean-Up, Paint-Up, Plant-Up Display - McKelvey School, winner of first prize in last year's clean-up campaign, is working hard to win again this year. Miss Wanda Jackson's second grade class made this display of "before-and-after" scenes in McKelvey School district.  in "Before" display, fences are run-down, houses need repair, and litter is shown scattered about.  In the "After" scene, houses and fences are fixed and painter, trash has been cleaned, and trees planted, making the "After" scene that of a desirable neighborhood. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of teacher Wanda Jackson, standing between a girl and three boys in second grade class holding "Before" and "After" signs above display of neighborhood homes and buildings for clean-up campaign, in McKelvy School
